results.title: December bride
results.creator_credit: Thaddeus O'Sullivan, Jonathan Cavendish, British Screen, Central TV, Film Four International and Little Bird
results.brief_description: Unfolding against the rolling contours of the beautiful Ulster coastline Thaddeus O’Sullivan’s film is a brooding and stunningly photographed drama of broken taboos within the harshly repressive atmosphere of a turn-of-the-century Presbyterian community. Sarah is the servant girl left alone on the Echlin farm with brothers Hamilton and Frank. Her subsequent pregnancy outrages local minister Sorleyson when she refuses to name the father or marry either of the two men. But can she find a way of living with the consequences that neither ostracises the family completely nor runs against her steadfastly independent principles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thaddeus O’Sullivan, Jonathan Cavendish, British Screen, Central TV, Film Four International and Little Bird

results.title: Decameron nights
results.brief_description: Based on the medieval romance collection by Boccaccio, Louis Jourdan (the author) narrates three of Boccaccio’s tales including; “Paganino the pirate”, “Wager for virture” and “The Doctor’s daughter”. Starring Joan Fontaine, Binnie Barnes and Joan Collins.

results.title: Decades of steam: the 1930's, the depression
results.creator_credit: Jeremy English and Ian Allan Limited
results.brief_description: This the second in the series of five videos tracing the story of steam locomotives during the middle of the 20th century. In this episode we look at the steam locomotive during the cold years of the depression. For the railways it was a period of austerity as they tried to meet the competition of the roads. The “Big Four” embarked on massive steam locomotive construction programs to replace the many different types inherited in 1923, although the Southern pursed electrification in order to eliminate steam. We visit familiar and not-so familiar locations to see steam at work, from the great main lines to the rural branches including Ireland which had 3 railways of its own and the Isle of Wight. Narrated by Ken Morgan.

results.title: Decades of steam : the 1960's, the final years
results.creator_credit: Jeremy English and Ian Allan Limited
results.brief_description: This is the fifth in the series of five videos tracing the story of steam locomotives during the middle years of the 20th century. In this episode we look at the 1960’s to see the end of steam locomotion on the public railway network in Great Britain. We see the last years of main line steam, the cruel blows of the Beeching “axe”, we see many branch lines destroyed forever, and the scrapping of their trains. Main line electrification and dieselisation would make even the famous “Duchesses”, “Kings” and “Bulleid Pacifics” redundant. However, a small gleam of light appeared on the horizon as railway preservation got underway, but after 11 August 1968 only one steam locomotive, the Flying Scotsman, was allowed to see out the decade working on the main lines. Narrated by Ken Morgan.

results.title: Overcoming Neck and Back Pain
results.creator_credit: G Roberts, Garry Egger and Centre for Health Promotion and Research
results.brief_description: Produced by a panel of back care experts in co-operation with the Royal Australian College of GP’s, this video is designed to provide information about back pain as well as a comprehensive exercise routine for dealing with and preventing back pain. Section 1: Basic back structure; Section 2: Day to day back care Section 3: Exercise routine.

results.title: Debbie and Robert: 12-24 months (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Child”.
Debbie and Robert’s behaviour is typical of the second year of life. Illustrates the process of learning that goes on through every waking hour, and the kind of guidance a parent can give.

results.title: 4 years-6 years = Four years to six years
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Dorothy Courtois, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Child”.
By the age of four the child is curious about the world around him. To find out, he is asking thousands of questions. He is also learning not to be afraid. This film shows children in learning situations: on a nature hike; handling animals and other creatures; dealing with their peers. One particularly interesting example is that of Ingrid and Helen, twins who look alike but act differently.

results.title: Kathy and Ian: three-year-olds
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child”.
By the age of three children become aware of themselves as unique. This happens through their continuing interaction with parents, siblings and friends. This film explores these relationships and the resulting development within the child.

results.title: Owning Mahowny
results.creator_credit: Richard Kwietniowski, Seaton McLean, Andras Hamori, Alessandro Camon, Natural Nylon, H2O Motion Pictures and Alliance Atlantis
results.brief_description: Impressive thriller about a mild-mannered, nebbish bank manager who, due to an obsessive gambling addiction, embezzles the bank where he works for several million dollars. Phillip Seymour Hoffman plays Dan Mahowny as a man whose self-delusions run deep, and whose desire to not only to remain in denial but also to keep his covert life secret from others, leads to extreme measures. What makes the film interesting is the way that Dan’s obsession and subsequent daring embezzlement builds slowly, spiralling out of his control. Hoffman depicts a man deluded but also conflicted by his choices that results in a great deal of suffering. Based on a true story.
